official-title.#text:
To designate the Johnson Valley National
		  Off-Highway Vehicle Recreation Area in San Bernardino County, California, to
		  authorize limited military use of the area, to provide for the transfer of the
		  Southern Study Area to the administrative jurisdiction of the Secretary of the
		  Navy for inclusion in the Marine Corps Air Ground Combat Center Twentynine
		  Palms, and by recreational users, and for other
		  purposes.

short-title.#text:
Johnson Valley National Off-Highway
			 Vehicle Recreation Area Establishment Act

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

header.#text:
Designation of Johnson
			 Valley National Off-Highway Vehicle Recreation Area

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: through the

in San Bernardino County, California, as
			 generally depicted as the

quote.#text:
Johnson Valley Off-Highway Vehicle Recreation
			 Area

quote.#tail:
and
			 dated April 11, 2013, are hereby designated as the
quote.#text:
Johnson Valley National Off-Highway
			 Vehicle Recreation Area and Transfer of the Southern Study Area

Johnson Valley
			 National Off-Highway Vehicle Recreation Area

text.#text:
The approximately 188,000 acres of public
			 land and interests in land administered by the

The Johnson
			 Valley National Off-Highway Vehicle Recreation Area is designated for the
			 following purposes:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Johnson Valley National Off-Highway Vehicle Recreation Area Establishment Act/s:3

text.#text:
Public recreation (including off-highway
			 vehicle use, camping, and hiking) when the lands are not used for military
			 training as authorized by

Natural resources
			 conservation.

The public land and interests in land
			 included in the Johnson Valley National Off-Highway Vehicle Recreation Area are
			 hereby withdrawn from all forms of appropriation under the public land laws,
			 including the mining laws and the mineral leasing and geothermal leasing
			 laws.

The designation of the
			 Johnson Valley National Off-Highway Vehicle Recreation Area and the withdrawal
			 of the public land and interests in land included in the Recreation Area are
			 subject to valid existing rights.

header.#text:
Limited biannual Marine
			 Corps Air Ground Combat Center Twentynine Palms use of Johnson Valley National
			 Off-Highway Vehicle Recreation Area

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Johnson Valley National Off-Highway Vehicle Recreation Area Establishment Act/s:3/ss:b

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall authorize the

to utilize portions of Johnson Valley National Off-Highway Vehicle
			 Recreation Area twice in each calendar year for up to a total of 60 days per
			 year for the following purposes:

text.#text:
Subject
			 to

Sustained, combined arms, live-fire, and
			 maneuver field training for large-scale Marine air-ground task forces.

Individual and unit
			 live-fire training ranges.
Equipment and tactics development.

Other defense-related
			 purposes consistent with the purposes specified in the preceding
			 paragraphs.

requests

text.#text: The

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall be conducted in the presence of
			 sufficient range safety officers to ensure the safety of military personnel and
			 civilians.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Johnson Valley National Off-Highway Vehicle Recreation Area Establishment Act/s:3/ss:a

text.#text:
Military use of the

			 periods authorized by

shall prohibit the
			 use of dud-producing ordnance in any military training conducted under

text.#text: The

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: and the

shall enter into a written
			 agreement to implement this section. The agreement shall include a provision
			 for periodic review of the agreement for its adequacy, effectiveness, and need
			 for revision.

text.#text: The
The agreement may provide for—

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: and the

text.#text:
the integration of the
			 management plans of the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: of the authority of the

to enforce the laws relating to protection of natural
			 and cultural resources and of fish and wildlife; and

text.#text:
delegation to civilian
			 law enforcement personnel of the

the sharing of resources
			 in order to most efficiently and effectively manage the lands.

Any agreement for the military use of the
			 Johnson Valley National Off-Highway Vehicle Recreation Area shall terminate not
			 later than March 31, 2039.

Transfer of

			 Combat Center Twentynine Palms, California

text.#text:
Not later than
			 September 30, 2014, the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Johnson Valley National Off-Highway Vehicle Recreation Area Establishment Act/s:4/ss:a

The legal description and
			 map filed under

for any costs incurred by
			 the
to carry out this section.

text.#text: The

Nothing in this Act
			 shall be construed—

to establish a
			 reservation in favor of the United States with respect to any water or water
			 right on lands transferred by this Act; or

to authorize the
			 appropriation of water on lands transferred by this Act except in accordance
			 with applicable State law.

This section shall not be
			 construed to affect any water rights acquired or reserved by the United States
			 before the date of the enactment of this Act.

header.#text:
Effect on previously
			 acquired or reserved water rights
